description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ul30","text":"This protocol describes Chu Lab standard external solutions for electrophysiology.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Brain slice physiology,Examine slices and patching cells ,Optogenetics

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3du2","text":"Turn on the MultiClamp 700B Amplifier, Axon Digidata 1550B digitizer, PatchStar Micromanipulator, PatchStar Slicescope, computer tower and the associated software. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8lr8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"96hkm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5fh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":74,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"d8jd2","text":"Note: amplifier and digitizer must be turned on prior to opening software.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ae2b","text":"Turn on O2/CO2 tank and bubble SIF solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":9,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":13,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5d1j","text":"Take an aliquot of internal solution, ATP, and GTP from   freezer and thaw  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55mt1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"21A8DFD0003B11EE82604B73E04F2913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"27095EA0003B11EE82604B73E04F2913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvqjv","text":"Once thawed, add ATP and GTP ( ) to aliquot of internal solution and mix well with a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c8l97","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"2BD05C90003B11EE82604B73E04F2913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dt3db","text":"Fill syringe with internal solution, place a filter on the end of the syringe, and place a MicroFil Pipette Filler on the end of the filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jcg8","text":"Turn on Peri-Star Pro pump and circulate recording solution through chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5uho6","text":"Adjust and set the rate of Peri-star pump to  /min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"asa6f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3-4","error":false,"guid":"3B99CDF0003B11EE82604B73E04F2913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Setting up patch rig and environment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"au0f7","text":"Turn on water heater and set to desired temperature (~ ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eubnu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"443C7F70003B11EE82604B73E04F2913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"33-34","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dsdm5","text":"Transfer brain slice from incubation beaker to the recording chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"99rdn","text":"Secure down slice with a harp (slice anchor).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1togh","text":"Locate and focus the desired brain region under the 4x objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjdvb","text":"Change the microscope lens to the 60x objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tusj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9n8kf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9l2dk","text":"Change slowly to ensure there is enough clearance and the lens does not get damaged.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cfojj","text":"If there is not enough clearance, move back to the 4x and raise the objective up, and then try again.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b05te","text":"Slowly focus on healthy neurons in slices for patching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b7pi6","text":"Fill a glass micropipette one-third full of internal solution (ensure there is no residual internal solution on exterior of glass micropipette, as this may introduce salts into the micromanipulator and add additional noise to recordings). Remove any air bubbles by gently flicking the glass micropipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3llgd","text":"Gently place the glass micropipette onto the wire electrode and tighten.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"909ig","text":"Apply a positive pressure and maintain it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"52nn7","text":"Position the electrode using a micromanipulator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eq9us","text":"Under the 60x objective, bring the tip of the glass pipette above the slice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e1ib7","text":"Approach the cell diagonally. The positive pressure should create a small dimple on the cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8ru7","text":"Once a dimple is formed, zero the pipette voltage, release the positive pressure, and apply a small amount of negative pressure. The resistance should begin to increase rapidly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bkr7d","text":"As the resistance increases, clamp the cell at your resting potential of interest (typically -70 mV).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"58ncb","text":"Once gigaseal formed, you can perform fast/slow capacitance compensation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5hjk","text":"After a giga-ohm seal is formed, apply a few quick pulses of negative pressure to break into the cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Examine slices and patching cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3asln","text":"Once whole cell configuration is formed, wait for   before the start of recording.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d0q8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"943B0370003B11EE82604B73E04F2913","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Optogenetics
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3atdg","text":"Light pulses (1 ms duration) for optogenetic stimulation were delivered using a 478 nm LED through a 60x water immersion objective lens. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oobj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"94t05","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"flblf","text":"Note: depending on the experimental design, synaptic blockers may be needed to isolate glutamatergic or GABAergic currents. Similarly, TTX and 4-AP can be applied to isolate monosynaptic responses from microcircuits with intensive local excitatory connections.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Optogenetics
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"54u98","text":"Under voltage clamp mode, adjust the intensity of LED to evoke synaptic currents of different amplitude. Repeat 3-5 sweeps per light intensity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice physiology: Optogenetics
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"17r55","text":"Similar procedures can be performed to evoke optogenetics-induced action potentials under current clamp mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Brain slice physiology and optogenetics
